titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Records of the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences Ultracomputer MC.385
titlestmt.author: Rachel Searcy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-09-25 13:50:50 -0400.

did.unittitle: Records of the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences Ultracomputer

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences. Library

did.abstract: The New York University Ultracomputer was developed in the 1980s at Computer Science department of the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences. Much of the original concept was developed by mathematician, computer scientist, and professor Jacob T. Schwartz. The Records of the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences Ultracomputer consist of schematics and logs of Ultracomputer II and Ultracomputer III from 1987.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Records of the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences Ultracomputer consist of schematics and logs of Ultracomputer II and Ultracomputer III from 1987.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact New York University Archives, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection was treated as an administrative transfer to the New York University Archives from the Courant Institute in the summer of 2023 when the Courant Institute Library closed. Original provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this transfer is 2023.040.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Records of the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences Ultracomputer; MC 385; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, materials were removed from original binders and rehoused in archival boxes and folders.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The New York University Ultracomputer was developed in the 1980s at Computer Science department of the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences. Much of the original concept was developed by mathematician, computer scientist, and professor Jacob T. Schwartz.
